primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The movement from the 'Upper Room' (private piety) to the 'Mount of Olives/Calvary' (public confrontation and social justice) as the definitive pattern of Christian existence.

subject.identificatie: Jesus (as the Prototype/Leader) and the Disciples (as the Church)
tekstueel_bewijs: Jesus and his friends went out to establish a new pattern of humanity.
This little band of men... went out into the Mount of Olives.

object.identificatie: A new principle of judgment and a new pattern of fellowship (Social Justice/Human Rights)
tekstueel_bewijs: He went out to give to the world a new principle of judgment.
The basis of a new pattern of fellowship.

zender.identificatie: The Purposes of God / The Moral Universe
tekstueel_bewijs: All related in some strange way to the purposes of God.
This nation... will live or die as it meets or fails to meet the purposes of God.

ontvanger.identificatie: The World / The Nation / The Oppressed
tekstueel_bewijs: He went out to give to the world...
Deliverance for the captives... setting at liberty those that are bruised.
ontvanger.positie_hoorder: The hearer identifies with the Subject (the disciple who must go out).

helper.identificatie: The 'Hymn' / The Upper Room (Worship as fuel)
tekstueel_bewijs: Without that first part the latter part might well have never been carried off with such gallantry.
helper.rol_van_god: God is the Object of faith in the Upper Room, but the Subject of the 'going out' is primarily the human band following Jesus.

tegenstander.identificatie: External Violence, Institutional Power, and Internal Cowardice
tekstueel_bewijs: The ugly glares of hatred and the angry prodding of impatient soldiers.
The craven cowardice and base desertion of almost every member.
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is primarily the 'machinery of state' and 'social externals' rather than radical ontological sin.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The internal psychological comfort of the believer.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Individual Believer
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The preacher subordinates the 'personal' (Upper Room) to the 'social' (Calvary/Mount of Olives).

actantieel_schema_visualisatie.zender_naar_ontvanger: Purposes of God → New Social Order → The World
actantieel_schema_visualisatie.helper_subject_tegenstander: The Hymn → The Church → The Machinery of State

voorbeelden_god_subject: God's love... issuing at Calvary in God's everlasting victory.
voorbeelden_mens_subject: We who are Christians are tempted...
They sang a hymn and went out.
We have assumed that our sense of community must be built upon geography.

voorbeelden: This nation... will live or die as it meets or fails to meet the purposes of God.
We will have failed as a people.
We are quite content to let that note fill our worship.
There are many who would like to have the blessed gospel of personal reconciliation.
Somehow we know looking at him dying...
What we forget is that the quiet and blessed scene...
Men and women... are willing to risk death in the name of his cause.

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon is a 'Call to Action.' It assumes the hearer has the capacity (Pouvoir) if they are properly motivated (Vouloir) by the knowledge (Savoir) of the 'New Principle' (Devoir).

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: Moves from S2 (Upper Room) to ~S2 (The threat of the mob) to S1 (The new principle of judgment).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The tension is resolved by making the 'Upper Room' a mere preparation for the 'Mount of Olives.'
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: S2 (Private Piety) is treated as 'winsome' but dangerously incomplete.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: While using the language of Calvary, the sermon functions as a 'Moral Influence' narrative. Jesus is the Subject who sets a 'pattern' or 'principle,' and the Church is the Subject who must now implement it.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: Jesus and his friends went out to establish a new pattern of humanity.
This nation... will live or die as it meets or fails to meet the purposes of God.

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: God's everlasting victory is the basis of a new pattern of fellowship.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Jesus is the 'Leader' who 'selected' friends; his death is a 'principle' and a 'pattern' for us to follow in the civil rights struggle.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: Christ as the sole Subject who endures the 'Noisy Confrontation' because the disciples (and we) are incapable, thereby gifting us a peace we did not earn.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Pressure to perform; burden of national survival placed on the believer's social activism.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The transition from 'Quiet' to 'Noisy' is rhetorically smooth but theologically shifts the burden of the 'victory' from Christ's finished work to the Church's ongoing 'gallantry.'
spanning_punten: The 'victory' is called 'God's', yet its success depends on the nation meeting 'purposes'.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: His deed at Calvary... judges our actions and our loyalties.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The 'Hymn' provides emotional competence, not supernatural endowment.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Sin is 'reproach' and 'cowardice,' primarily seen in social failure.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon casts the Church as the Subject of the 'Mount of Olives' experience, with Jesus as the Exemplar. This creates a Devoir-faire (obligation) structure.

subject_herpositionering.huidige_probleem: The disciples/Church are the ones 'carrying off' the mission with 'gallantry.'
subject_herpositionering.voorgestelde_herpositionering: Make Christ the Subject of the 'Going Out'—He goes out because we cannot.
subject_herpositionering.voorbeeld_revisie: Instead of 'They went out to establish a new pattern,' use 'Christ went out to the Mount of Olives to reclaim a world his disciples were too weak to save.'

identificatie_herstel.strategie: Emphasize the 'craven cowardice' not as a hurdle to overcome, but as the reason Christ acts alone.

modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Focus on how the 'Victory' at Calvary actually empowers the weak, rather than just 'judging' them.

tegenstander_intensivering.voorgestelde_intensivering: Identify the Opponent as the 'Power of Death' which no amount of 'human rights' can defeat without a Divine Subject.
tegenstander_intensivering.theologische_rationale: To move from social activism to Gospel proclamation.

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.probleem: The 'Secondary Program' (Ethics) is driving the 'Primary Program' (Soteriology).
narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.voorgestelde_structuur: Soteriology (Christ's victory for us) → Ethics (Our response).

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: The sermon is a powerful piece of social rhetoric, but it risks turning the Cross into a 'principle' rather than an 'event' of rescue.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: Rhetorically, the 'Quiet/Noisy' contrast is brilliant; actantially, it reveals a shift of agency from God to the Church.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis might focus on the Passover context; Greimas reveals the 'engine' is the hearer's duty to the nation.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Greimas exposes that 'Jesus' is often used as a Helper for the Church's Subject-role, rather than being the Subject Himself.

appendices.notities: The sermon heavily utilizes the 'Axis of Transmission' to pass a mandate from the 'Purposes of God' to the 'Nation' via the 'Church'.
